intro: Kohautia platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are broad and flat, which distinguishes it from other members of its family. Kohautia platyphylla produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
